title: invalidArguments doesn't take keyword args into account
body_html: If someone passes keyword arguments to any of our C functions, they won't appear in the error message (as if they weren't specified). There's the same issue with the out argument (see #364) - if you specify correct args, but e.g. pass out=(torch.LongTensor(), torch.FloatTensor()) to max, the message will appear as if all arguments were correct (while out has invalid order). It can be pretty confusing.
body_text: If someone passes keyword arguments to any of our C functions, they won't appear in the error message (as if they weren't specified). There's the same issue with the out argument (see #364) - if you specify correct args, but e.g. pass out=(torch.LongTensor(), torch.FloatTensor()) to max, the message will appear as if all arguments were correct (while out has invalid order). It can be pretty confusing.
body: If someone passes keyword arguments to any of our C functions, they won't appear in the error message (as if they weren't specified). There's the same issue with the `out` argument (see #364) - if you specify correct args, but e.g. pass `out=(torch.LongTensor(), torch.FloatTensor())` to `max`, the message will appear as if all arguments were correct (while `out` has invalid order). It can be pretty confusing.
